intro: Oxylobus glandulifer, commonly known as the glandular-leafed oxylobus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, glandular-dotted leaves and delicate, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
